strings.Value: "As far as I have heard, there is a big dwarven clan, the Langebukk, somewhere in Druma. I guess they own some sort of trade caravan business. They even own a store in Restov, supposedly."
"Do you know anything about this clan?"
"For all we know, the dwarves just left. We can't be so sure about their deaths."

"Dwarves like to mark the walls of their fortresses and caves. They use their clan-rune for this purpose. Usually they enchant this rune to spread light, so the dwarves can proudly observe it even in the total darkness." {n}Harrim examines the rune one more time.{/n} "Where is all your pride now, oh Langebukk Clan?"
"So they didn't perish yet, after all… what a shame." {n}Harrim lets out a discontented sigh.{/n} "Anyway, every living creature is bound to die," {n}he claims, but without too much certainty.{/n}

{n}Harrim sighs with sadness.{/n} "We know they had left and we know they have never returned to the dwarven kingdom in the South. So what do you imagine could happen to them?" {n}Harrim shakes his head resignedly, his beard making a slight rustling sound while moving over his chest.{/n} "No, {name}. All your hopes are empty. As are any hopes in the world, I must add..."

{n}Harrim nods with dignity, pulling his beard again.{/n} "Dwarves have long, long lives. When my father was still young, he saw the Langebukk's exodus from {g|Five Kings Mountains}Five Kings Mountains{/g}. They were heading to the North. Whole city had gathered then to wave goodbye to them. No one ever saw them again. Now I know what horrible fate befell over their poor souls..."
"Where their path ended? I don't see a mountain of skulls below this rune. Some historians have lost their diplomas for such rash conclusions and sweeping generalizations!"
"I never tire of dwarves who consider themselves long-lived... Compared to elves, you're basically mayflies."
"That's it, we're done for. The old ones got started talking about age. We should just set up camp right here — this'll take forever!"

"Look, this is the rune of the Langebukk clan. Their whole clan must have perished many years ago. Now we know the place where their path ended. Let {g|Groetus}Groetus{/g} wrap them up in his eternal emptiness." {n}Harrim reaches his hand forwards, as if trying to touch the rune, but at the last moment, he jerks his fingers away.{/n}
